business.headline: IndiGo flight cancellations: Your complete guide to refundsIndiGo has informed the DGCA that full operational stabilisation is expected only by February 10, 2026, with continued cancellations anticipated until December 8.​

IndiGo crisis sends Delhi–Mumbai flight prices soaring to over Rs 80,000The Delhi–Mumbai corridor, which connects the national capital with the country's financial centre, is one of the busiest air routes globally. Any disruption on this route immediately affects business travellers, tourists, and daily commuters.

When two airlines rule the skies: Is India's aviation duopoly failing flyers?IndiGo's mass cancellations have exposed a deeper fault line in Indian aviation, where a growing duopoly means one airline's trouble can disrupt travel plans for the entire country.

Will personal loans become cheaper after the RBI's latest repo rate cut?Are borrowers finally set to get some relief as the RBI trims the repo rate by 25 basis points? Could this policy shift translate into lower personal loan rates soon? Read here.
Your FD investments to take a hit as RBI cuts repo rateIs your FD income set to shrink as banks prepare to reduce deposit rates after the RBI's rate cut? Let's have a look.

RBI reduces repo rate by 25 bps. Will your home loans get cheaper?RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said the committee unanimously agreed on the rate cut after assessing inflation trends, growth forecasts and liquidity needs.

IndiGo shares tumble 2% as mass flight cancellations continue to disrupt travel IndiGo's stock fell over 2%, trading at Rs 5,326.35 by 10 am, amid mounting concerns over ongoing mass cancellations and delays across India's busiest airports.

RBI reduces key lending rate by 25 points to 5.25%, maintains neutral stanceThe rate cut takes the repo rate down from 5.5% to 5.25%. Alongside this, the Standing Deposit Facility (SDF) rate has been adjusted to 5%, while the Marginal Standing Facility (MSF) rate and the bank rate now stand at 5.5%.

Who is Avadhut Sathe, Pune finfluencer whose trading academy got banned by SebiSebi said that Avadhut Sathe Trading Academy was running an unregistered investment advisory business disguised as education, misleading investors through selective performance claims, paid WhatsApp groups, and live market recommendations.

Sensex, Nifty open flat as investors eye RBI's MPC decisionAround 9:36 am, the Sensex was down 60 points at 85,325, while the Nifty hovered just above the 26,000 mark with a modest 11 point gain. Broader market indices were largely in the red, reflecting the nervousness ahead of the policy outcome.

RBI MPC announcement today: Will the all-time low rupee force a rate cut?Earlier this year, the RBI cut the repo rate by 100 basis points across three rounds, supported by falling inflation. But the backdrop has now shifted.

Sebi bans finfluencer Avadhut Sathe, freezes Rs 546 crore in major crackdownThe order, issued on December 4, marks a turning point in Sebi's push to clean up the finfluencer ecosystem, where many online trainers claim to offer education but end up giving specific stock tips, guidance and live trading calls without any regulatory licence.

Putin says Trump's tariff stance reflects fear of India's economic riseRussian President Putin said that the tariff actions by US President Donald Trump and concerns raised by Western nations over India's Russian oil imports reflect worry about India's rising economic influence.

No need for haste: Vladimir Putin on BRICS currency, de-dollarisationVladimir Putin's comments come at a time when conversations around de-dollarisation, alternative payment networks, and local currency trade have gained momentum within the BRICS bloc, especially after Western sanctions reshaped the global financial landscape.

Our energy cooperation with India remains unaffected, says Vladimir PutinAs Western pressure intensifies on countries buying Russian crude, Vladimir Putin said that India–Russia energy ties will continue unhindered and remain anchored in long-standing commercial trust.

Move out of comfort zone: Uday Kotak warns businesses as rupee hits record lowRecent comments by Uday Kotak highlight the effects of foreign investor actions on the Indian stock market, with Indian investors responding as buyers amid international exits.
Sensex, Nifty recover to end higher as IT stocks lift marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 158.51 points to close at 85,265.32, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 47.75 points to end at 26,033.75.

New rent rules for 2025: Will tenants finally get a fair deal?High rental deposits often force families to block large sums of money for years. The new 2025 rules hope to fix that. An expert breaks down how these changes could reshape renting and strengthen household finances.

India's economy is booming, but why is the rupee tumbling?India's economic growth is surging, yet the rupee keeps weakening as global risks rise and dollar demand expands. Why is a growing economy unable to prevent its currency from sliding further?

IBM CEO Arvind Krishna explains why tech layoffs have increasedIBM itself announced plans this year to cut thousands of jobs as it shifts focus to areas like artificial intelligence consulting and software.

entertainment.headline: Nicolas Cage to lead live-action Spider-Noir series, premiering in 2026 Academy Award–winner Nicolas Cage will star in the upcoming Spider-Noir series, a live-action adaptation based on Marvel's Spider-Man Noir comics. The series is scheduled for a 2026 premiere.

After Murder track, Raghav Juyal croons another Emraan Hashmi hit in new ad. Watch After impressing fans with their camaraderie in The Ba***ds of Bollywood, Emraan Hashmi and Raghav Juyal reunited for a new ad.

Stephen movie review: A psychological thriller that spins out of controlRelease Date:Fri Dec 05, 2025 Stephen movie review: Directed by Mithun Balaji, Stephen is a psychological crime thriller featuring Gomathi Shankar, Smruti Venkat and Michael in key roles. The film delves deep into the psyche of a serial killer and what contributed to it.

Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 turns one; read what actor said to thank fans, team Actor Allu Arjun thanks fans and his team after completing five years with the Pushpa film franchise, highlighting the journey's impact and the film's growing international presence.

Dhurandhar hits theatres: Second part of Ranveer's film to release on this date The first part of Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar released in cinemas today, with the second part scheduled for theatrical release early next year. The film features an ensemble cast, including Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal, Akshaye Khanna, R Madhavan, Rakesh Bedi, and Sara Arjun.

Bigg Boss 19: How Gaurav Khanna outplayed the noise to win the finale ticket Gaurav Khanna's calm and consistent gameplay in Bigg Boss 19, often mistaken for weakness, won him the viewers' trust and the first Ticket to Finale. His mature approach and steady presence stood out in a house full of chaos, earning praise from Salman Khan and fans alike.

Four More Shots Please: Release date of fourth and final season announced The concluding chapter of the popular Indian series 'Four More Shots Please!' will launch worldwide on December 19. The series stars Sayani Gupta, Kirti Kulhari, Maanvi Gagroo and Bani J in the lead roles.

Tere Ishk Mein box office: Here's how much Dhanush's film earned globally in 1st week Tere Ishk Mein has made a strong global debut, earning Rs 118.76 crore in its first week and showcasing widespread audience appeal. The film's emotional narrative, AR Rahman's music, and powerful performances have contributed to its sustained success despite new releases.

Dhurandhar X review: Fans say Ranveer Singh's film is pure paisa vasool Ranveer Singh's much-anticipated film 'Dhurandhar' has been released in theatres today. Going by early reviews on X, the film is a total mass entertainer and some social media users have even rated it 5 stars.

Hope after 15 months: Celina Jaitly updates on brother's UAE detention case Bollywood actor Celina Jaitly received support from the Delhi High Court as it ordered the Ministry of External Affairs to help her communicate with her brother, Major Vikrant Kumar Jaitly. He has been detained in the UAE since September 2024.

It's Dhurandhar Day today: Read Yami Gautam's post on husband Aditya Dhar's film Actor Yami Gautam shared a post on X and celebrated husband Aditya Dhar's latest film Dhurandhar. She gave a shout-out to the entire team while praising their efforts.

Aishwarya Rai bonds with Dakota Johnson, Jessica Alba at Red Sea Festival. Pics Aishwarya Rai Bachchan made a notable appearance at the Red Sea Film Festival 2025, where her interactions with international stars Dakota Johnson and Jessica Alba sparked online interest.

Kamal Haasan mourns AVM Saravanan, reflects on six-decade bond Veteran Tamil producer AVM Saravanan died at 86, prompting tributes from across the film industry. Kamal Haasan reflected on his personal and professional connection with Saravanan and AVM Productions, underlining the impact the producer had on Tamil cinema.

Actor Kim Cattrall marries longtime partner Russell Thomas in London ceremony Sex and the City actor Kim Cattrall got married to her partner of nine years, Russell Thomas, in a private gathering at Chelsea Old Town Hall in London. The intimate wedding was attended by a small group of family and friends.

Akhanda 2 release postponed: Why Balakrishna's film was delayed amid legal row Nandamuri Balakrishna's much-anticipated Telugu sequel, Akhanda 2, has been postponed indefinitely amid mounting legal and financial troubles. The film, previously set for a December 5 release, faces uncertainty amid confusion in the Telugu states and a court dispute involving Eros International.

HBO sets Euphoria 3 for April 2026, unveils major Game of Thrones expansion HBO announced the return of Zendaya's Euphoria season 3 in April. Other than this, the network also teased the expansion of popular series Game of Thrones at the London event.

Rakesh Bedi: If I wasn't typecast, I wouldn't have survived for so many years Veteran actor Rakesh Bedi talks about being repeatedly cast as a comedian over the decades, and opens up about his latest role as a Pakistani politician in the film Dhurandhar in an exclusive interview

The Summer I Turned Pretty movie to release this Christmas? Creator shares update Popular Prime Video series The Summer I Turned Pretty movie is one of the highly anticipated dramas. While fans wait excitedly to catch a glimpse of their favourite actor, creator Jenny Han spilled the beans about the release.

New Men in Black film in works, Sony brings Chris Bremner on board as writer Sony Pictures moves forward with a new Men in Black installment, bringing on Chris Bremner as writer. The studio has not attached any talent yet, but plans involve approaching actor Will Smith to potentially reprise his role.

general news.headline: Live: India, Russia stand together in fight against terror, says PM ModiRussian President Putin in India Live Updates: Russian President Vladimir Putin, who landed in Delhi on Thursday evening, has begun his busy schedule for the day as he was given a grand ceremonial welcome at the Rashtrapati Bhavan, with counterpart Droupadi Murmu and PM Narendra Modi present. After Rashtrapati Bhavan, Putin went to Rajghat and paid floral tribute to Mahatma Gandhi, before heading to Hyderabad House where he is currently conducting a bilateral meeting with PM Modi. Later, both leaders will address a joint press conference and at 7 pm, President Murmu will host a dinner for her Russian counterpart. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

IndiGo flight chaos: Centre eases duty rules, urges pilots to cooperateIndiGo chaos: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation withdrew a provision that prevented airlines from counting crew leave as a substitute for weekly rest. It came as IndiGo was forced to cancel over a thousand flights this week.

India not neutral, is on side of peace: PM's message to Putin on Ukraine warThe Ukraine conflict featured prominently in the bilateral meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Russia's Putin. PM Modi reiterated that India was on the side of peace, and it was not the era of war.

Govt mulls always-on phone tracking, Apple and Samsung push back over privacyAfter the Sanchar Saathi App brouhaha, the Government is reportedly considering mandatory always-on location tracking of all smartphones in India, a move which brands like Apple, Samsung, and Google are said to be pushing against, over privacy concerns.

Diplomatic dating: India's geopolitical romance in 2025India's relationship with the US may be in the exciting-but-uncertain dating phase, but the partnership with Russia is a comfortable, decades-old bond — the one built on shared history, mutual reliance, and the knowledge that they've survived worse.

IndiGo mess gets messier, over 750 flights cancelled today; all Delhi ops hitDelhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru, and Hyderabad were the worst-affected cities today, leaving hundreds of passengers stranded and throwing travel plans into disarray. The airline cancelled all the 235 flights in the national capital.

Revealed: How Putin is silently recalibrating on TrumpRussian President Vladimir Putin has called his American counterpart Donald Trump "sincere" during an exclusive interview with the India Today Group. However, he teared into Trump's advisors and the West. Is Putin fighting the West's hegemony while making peace with Trump the individual?

Wah Taj, and a nuclear nudge: How Putin's first India visit gave a pat to PokhranAs Russian President Vladimir Putin landed in New Delhi on Thursday, the moment inevitably looped back to his very first India trip a quarter-century ago. In 2000, a 47-year-old new Russian president arrived in winter-soaked Delhi to reboot an old partnership. The 2000 visit saw him do a namaste in Parliament, stroll through the Taj Mahal, and deliver a quiet nuclear nudge to India by posing in front of the nuclear reactor for Pokhran tests.

Dhurandhar review: Ranveer leads, but Akshaye rules this labyrinth of war, politicsRelease Date:Fri Dec 05, 2025Dhurandhar is Aditya Dhar's most politically assertive film, tracing India's covert operations through real historical tragedies. Ranveer Singh leads with conviction, but Akshaye Khanna delivers the most compelling performance.

Live: IndiGo issues apology; assures refund and accommodationIndia's largest air carrier IndiGo's troubles dragged into a third straight day on Friday, with over 750 flights scrubbed across major hubs, on top of more than 550 cancellations the day before. The airline has cancelled all 235 flights at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport today, snarling airport operations and leaving passengers stranded.

The airline said it expects to restore full stability only by February 10, 2026, and has asked for temporary relief from flight-duty norms. IndiGo admitted that the ongoing chaos stems from miscalculations and planning lapses while rolling out Phase 2 of the Flight Duty Time Limitations (FDTL) rules. It also warned the regulator that cancellations will continue through December 8, with service reductions already in force since December 4. Stay tuned with India Today for all Live Updates.
IndiGo Blues: Why India is the Waterloo for AirlinesSince 1991 liberalisation, India has buried several airlines—from East-West to GoFirst—proving its skies the world's deadliest graveyard.

When two airlines rule the skies: Is India's aviation duopoly failing flyers?IndiGo's mass cancellations have exposed a deeper fault line in Indian aviation, where a growing duopoly means one airline's trouble can disrupt travel plans for the entire country.

Indigo flight crisis forces newlyweds to join their own wedding reception virtuallyA newlywed couple missed their wedding reception in Karnataka's Hubbali after IndiGo flight cancellations left them stranded in Odisha's Bhubaneswar. Their family went ahead with the event. The couple joined virtually as rituals were performed in their absence.

Dhurandhar Review and Release Live: Available OTT info on Ranveer Singh film hereDhurandhar Movie Review and Release Live Updates: Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar has opened on Friday, December 5. The Aditya Dhar film is set against the backdrop of real-life events involving geopolitical conflicts, covert operations by the Indian Army, and other outfits.

Sebi bans finfluencer Avadhut Sathe, freezes Rs 546 crore in major crackdownThe order, issued on December 4, marks a turning point in Sebi's push to clean up the finfluencer ecosystem, where many online trainers claim to offer education but end up giving specific stock tips, guidance and live trading calls without any regulatory licence.

Can Virat Kohli reach 100 hundreds? The dream vs the reality in numbersAt 84 centuries, Virat Kohli stands at the edge of cricket's last great mountain. His twin tons against South Africa have revived a dream once fading. But can belief, form and time align for one final miracle?

IndiGo crisis sends Delhi–Mumbai flight prices soaring to over Rs 80,000The Delhi–Mumbai corridor, which connects the national capital with the country's financial centre, is one of the busiest air routes globally. Any disruption on this route immediately affects business travellers, tourists, and daily commuters.

RBI reduces repo rate by 25 bps. Will your home loans get cheaper?RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said the committee unanimously agreed on the rate cut after assessing inflation trends, growth forecasts and liquidity needs.

Greatest catch in Ashes history? Marnus Labuschagne's flying attempt stuns fansAshes 2025: Marnus Labuschagne took a sensational one-handed diving catch to dismiss Jofra Archer and end a 60-run stand that was frustrating Australia in the pink-ball Test in Brisbane on Friday, December 5.
Your fashion moodboard ft. Cloud Dancer, Pantone Colour of the Year 2026Choosing a hue of white seems to be a bold choice for Pantone this year or maybe we want more than just that.

Why PM Modi picked a Fortuner for carpool with Putin? Theories behind itPutin in India: There was a red carpet welcome, PM Modi breaking protocol to greet him on the tarmac, a firm handshake, followed by a warm hug. However, what caught the attention was PM Modi choosing a white Toyota Fortuner to carpool with Putin.

With just one phone number ProxyEarth is showing location, details of all IndiansImagine this: with just one phone number you have the ability to look at everyone's location, sometimes even live location in real-time, complete with details like full name, address and father's name. This is no joke because a rogue website called ProxyEarth is allowing just that.

Explained: IndiGo blues that left passengers seeing redThis week alone, IndiGo recorded over 1,200 flight cancellations, its on-time performance (OTP) fell to 67.70 per cent in November from 84.1 per cent in October, per data submitted to DGCA and shared by the Ministry of Civil Aviation.

Dhurandhar review: Ranveer leads, but Akshaye rules this labyrinth of war, politicsRelease Date:Fri Dec 05, 2025Dhurandhar is Aditya Dhar's most politically assertive film, tracing India's covert operations through real historical tragedies. Ranveer Singh leads with conviction, but Akshaye Khanna delivers the most compelling performance.

Dhurandhar Release: Sana Farzeen Reports On Box Office, Yami's Post & Kantara RowIn this special report, India Today Associate Editor Sana Farzeen reviews the theatrical release of Ranveer Singh's massive action film 'Dhurandhar'. Directed by Aditya Dhar, the film marks Singh's return to cinemas with a runtime of 3 hours 34 minutes and an 'A' certificate. Farzeen reports from Cinepolis Andheri, noting that while morning shows saw 22-37% occupancy, night shows are nearly 50% blocked. The report also highlights key controversies surrounding the film, including Yami Gautam's statement on paid reviews and the legal trouble involving Ranveer Singh's alleged disrespect of the 'Kantara' tradition at IFFI.

sports.headline: Riyan Parag breaks silence on RR captaincy rumours after Sanju Samson exit With Sanju Samson traded to Chennai Super Kings, Rajasthan Royals are set to appoint a new captain for IPL 2026. Riyan Parag, who led the team as stand-in captain in IPL 2025, addressed the possibility of taking over full-time duties while weighing the challenges of leadership.

NZ vs WI: Shai Hope closes in on Gary Sobers with gritty hundred in Christchurch West Indies batter Shai Hope scored a gritty century on Day 4 against New Zealand at Hagley Oval. He rescued his team from a precarious position of 72/4 chasing 531.

VIPs get passes, fans get chaos: Ticket fiasco hits Cuttack ahead of T20I series IND vs SA: The fans were left scampering for match tickets in Cuttack on Friday, December 5. The less number of tickets released for the game meant that fans had to stand overnight in queues to get their hands on the T20I tickets.

Where is Mohammed Shami? Agarkar faces tough questions as pacer stays sidelined India vs South Africa: Senior fast bowler Mohammed Shami has been repeatedly overlooked for international assignments despite consistent performances on the domestic circuit. Former spinner Harbhajan Singh has questioned the selection committee over Shami's exclusion.

Are Kohli's wild century celebrations linked to the end of his Test career? IND vs SA: Virat Kohli's wild celebrations are going viral on social media in the ODI series. R Ashwin speculated that Kohli's celebrations might be linked to his Test retirement.

Greatest catch in Ashes history? Marnus Labuschagne's flying attempt stuns fans Ashes 2025: Marnus Labuschagne took a sensational one-handed diving catch to dismiss Jofra Archer and end a 60-run stand that was frustrating Australia in the pink-ball Test in Brisbane on Friday, December 5.

What stops KL Rahul from scoring barrage of centuries in ODIs? Dale Steyn reveals Dale Steyn has praised KL Rahul's adaptability and finishing abilities in India's middle order during the ongoing ODI series against South Africa, suggesting Rahul would score more centuries if given top-order opportunities.

Joe Root saved our eyes: Grace Hayden's hilarious reaction to batter's hundred Matthew Hayden's daughter Grace had a hilarious reaction to Joe Root hitting his maiden Test century in Australia. Grace took to Instagram to thank the gods, for a very specific reason.

After Virat Kohli's successive centuries, 3rd ODI tickets sell out in minutes Virat Kohli's consecutive centuries have caused a rapid sell-out of tickets for the third ODI in Visakhapatnam. The star batter scored back-to-back hundreds in first two matches in Ranchi and Raipur.

FC Goa captain shown red card before kick-off in Super Cup semi-final Super Cup: An incredibly rare incident happened in FC Goa's Super Cup semi-final against Mumbai City FC. Goa's captain Iker Guarrotxena was shown a straight red card before the match even started.

Pant, Rinku or Dube: Who is best suited to fix India's ODI finisher problem? Aside from the dew, one issue has followed India throughout this ODI series against South Africa: the lack of runs from the lower order. KL Rahul has produced back-to-back half-centuries in the role. Still, the continued struggles of Washington Sundar and Ravindra Jadeja have left India without a dependable finisher in the format.

Can Virat Kohli reach 100 hundreds? The dream vs the reality in numbersAt 84 centuries, Virat Kohli stands at the edge of cricket's last great mountain. His twin tons against South Africa have revived a dream once fading. But can belief, form and time align for one final miracle?

Andre Russell breaks silence on shock IPL retirement: Here's what really happenedWest Indies all-rounder Andre Russell has finally opened up on his shocking retirement from the Indian Premier League (IPL) ahead of the 2026 edition of the tournament. Russell was released by Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) ahead of the auction for upcoming edition.

Average Joe to Not a Bad Root: England star makes Aussie media eat their wordsAshes: Before the Gabba hundred, Joe Root had been labelled "Average Joe" by the West Australian newspaper, but by Friday morning the same publication had performed a swift U-turn, splashing "He's not a bad Root after all" across its front page.

Why are they doing this? Ex-opener says Siraj reduced to one-format bowlerIND vs SA: Aakash Chopra questions why Mohammed Siraj has been pushed out of India's white-ball squads, noting his strong economy rates against Australia and insisting the pacer deserves more than a one-format role.

How Australia's pace-only strategy helped England in Gabba day-night TestAustralia's bold call to leave out Nathan Lyon for the Gabba day-night Test is already drawing scrutiny, with England's top order openly acknowledging how the absence of the veteran off spinner helped them settle into rhythm on a fluctuating opening day.

Joe Root played the innings of his life in Gabba Test: Atherton hails England batterAshes 2025: Michael Atherton hailed Joe Root's long-awaited Gabba century as the finest innings of his career. Root's composure under immense early pressure from Starc and Boland turned gave England an anchor amidst a batting collapse.

Messi shocks fans with sceptical World Cup claim: At worst, I will be watchingLionel Messi has shocked football fans by admitting he may not play at the 2026 World Cup, even as he stressed his desire to join Argentina's title defence. The world champions will travel to North America without any confirmation from their captain, whose future remains uncertain as he nears his 39th birthday.

East Bengal into AIFF Super Cup final after humbling Punjab FC 3-1East Bengal powered into the AIFF Super Cup final with a commanding 3–1 win over Punjab FC. A blend of sharp finishing and set-piece dominance guided Oscar Bruzon's side to their second cup final of the season.

Nathan Lyon furious after Gabba Test snub, refused to sit with coach and selectorsAustralian spinner Nathan Lyon has voiced his disappointment after being dropped for the second Ashes test in Brisbane, his first home omission since 2012. Despite his strong record, selectors opted for an all-pace attack, with Michael Neser included in the squad.

Lando Norris not asking McLaren for favours as F1 title fight goes down to Abu DhabiNorris refuses to ask teammate Oscar Piastri for a title-deciding favour, even if it hands Max Verstappen the crown. As McLaren eyes a rare double, the Brit insists the championship should be earned on track — not gifted through team orders.

Wasim Akram still the GOAT: Mitchell Starc reacts after breaking all-time recordMitchell Starc rewrote history at the Gabba by becoming the most successful left-arm fast bowler in Test cricket. Yet even after breaking Wasim Akram's record, he insisted the Pakistani legend remains the true pinnacle of left-arm pace.

Zak Crawley praises humble Joe Root after much-awaited Australia hundredAshes: Zak Crawley praised a "flawless" Joe Root after the 34-year-old finally ended his long wait for an Ashes century in Australia on the opening day of the pink-ball Test in Brisbane on Thursday.

Vikramaditya Chaufla beats Russian veteran on way to Indian Racketlon Open titleRacketlon is a fast growing sport where the competitors are required to play four racket sports: table tennis, badminton, tennis and squash.

Snubbed for SA T20Is, Mohammed Shami shines in SMAT to knock on selection doorsMohammed Shami, left out of India's T20I squad for the South Africa tour, knocked on the selection doors once again with the match-winning bowling performance in SMAT.

Root not just an average Joe: Conquering the final frontier leaves Aussies red-facedAshes 2025-26, 2nd Test: Joe Root answered years of Australian criticism with his first Ashes century Down Under, turning the "average Joe" jibe on its head and giving England a powerful foothold in the day-night Test after posting more than 300 in the first innings.

Go ball, yes Joe: Ben Stokes full of emotions as Root snaps century-curse at GabbaAshes 2025: Joe Root's long-awaited maiden century in Australia lit up an otherwise tense opening day at the Gabba. Ben Stokes' emotional celebration captured the magnitude of the moment as England battled to stay afloat in the Ashes opener.

Dewald Brevis's Raipur special amazes Pretoria Capitals coach Sourav GangulyFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly said Pretoria Capitals are particularly excited about securing Dewald Brevis's services for the long term. Ganguly praised the young South African after he lit up Raipur with a blistering knock that played a key role in one of the most remarkable run chases ever seen on Indian soil.

Root vs Starc's magical tussle sets tone for gripping Pink Ball Test in GabbaAshes: A gripping battle between Joe Root and Mitchell Starc set the tone for what could turn out to be a defining Test match at the Gabba. The duo headlined Day 1 of the 2nd Test where the teams traded blows in a see-sawing game.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
